x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Mental health support is often fragmented, stigmatized, and difficult to access especially for youth, caregivers, and underserved communities. People struggle to find the right resources, whether it’s a counselor, peer support group, helpline, or self-care tool. NGOs and local clinics lack a unified system to guide individuals based on urgency, language, affordability, or cultural sensitivity. This leads to delays, dropouts, and emotional isolation. In crisis situations, the lack of a clear, personalized pathway can be life-threatening.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • App Engine Studio for resource records, assessments, and user profiles
  • Flow Designer for routing, nudges, and escalation workflows
  • Virtual Agent for conversational guidance and anonymous triage
  • IntegrationHub for syncing with helpline APIs, WhatsApp, or SMS gateways
  • UI Builder for clean, sponsor-friendly dashboards and mobile views
  • Scoped App with ACLs for privacy, consent, and role-based access
  • QR Code Generation & Base64 Encoding for access cards and posters

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Helpline APIs or NGO databases for resource sync
  • WhatsApp/SMS gateway for follow-ups and nudges
  • QR code generation for access cards and anonymous entry
  • Optional: Sentiment analysis API for feedback tagging
  • Optional: Calendar integration for appointment reminders

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring privacy and consent for sensitive emotional data
  • Designing a non-triggering, empathetic UX for vulnerable users
  • Encouraging NGO adoption and regular updates to resource listings
  • Balancing automation with human warmth in follow-ups
  • Building trust and safety for anonymous users
